justification: “we collected a self-report questionnaire that measures proclivity to various odd or unusual beliefs (Peters Delusions Inventory [PDI])”
“The Paranoia Checklist is a 18-item measure of paranoid beliefs in the general population.”

measured_by: Abbreviated nine-item Raven’s Standard Progressive Matrices
justification: Participants’ “measures of general cognition 47” refer to the short Raven’s matrices developed by Bilker and colleagues cited in reference 47.

measured_by: Prior-weight parameter (ω₁) from the weighted Bayesian model fit to the probability-estimates beads task
justification: “Examining the fitted prior-weight ω1 parameter values across participants revealed … underweighting of prior beliefs (ω1<1), consistent with sequential base-rate neglect.”

measured_by: Mean final estimate difference between back-loaded and front-loaded evidence sequences
justification: “pair-wise differences in final probability estimates were higher for back-loaded versus front-loaded sequences… this effect was referred to as a recency bias.”

measured_by: Slope of logit belief update as a function of logit prior
justification: “we observed that mean logit belief updates… decreased as prior certainty increased… an effect we refer to as prior-dependent belief updating.”
